thread.title: Clinton aide Huma Abedin testifies before Benghazi committee
thread.title_full: Clinton aide Huma Abedin testifies before Benghazi committee - US News

author: USNews
title: Clinton aide Huma Abedin testifies before Benghazi committee
text:
Longtime Clinton confidante Huma Abedin meets with Benghazi investigators behind closed doors Associated Press Oct. 16, 2015 | 9:58 a.m. EDT + More By MATTHEW DALY, Associated Press
WASHINGTON (AP) â€” A close aide to Hillary Rodham Clinton is testifying before the House panel investigating the deadly attacks in Benghazi, Libya.
Huma Abedin is a longtime Clinton confidante and staffer. She's meeting behind closed doors with investigators Friday. Clinton herself is scheduled to appear before the Benghazi panel next Thursday in a widely anticipated public hearing.
The Benghazi panel is under intense scrutiny after two House Republicans described it as partisan and aimed at hurting Clinton's presidential bid. That's a characterization the committee's chairman rejects.
Abedin is vice chairwoman of Clinton's campaign and was a top aide when Clinton served as secretary of state and U.S. senator from New York.
The panel interviewed Clinton aides Cheryl Mills and Jake Sullivan last month.
